snippet: Mayor Angel Taveras of Providence, R.I., said the only way the city could avoid bankruptcy was by scaling back pension benefits.
abstract: Providence City Council in Rhode Island signs off on a plan by Mayor Angel Taveras to end annual cost-of-living increases for about 3,000 retired police officers, firefighters and other employees getting city pensions; cuts are estimated to save the city about $16 million in the 2013 fiscal year and may help it stave off bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Angel Taveras of Providence, R.I., said the only way the city could avoid bankruptcy was by scaling back pension benefits.

headline.main: Providence Mayor Moves Financial Woes to Fore
headline.print_headline: Providence Mayor Moves Financial Woes to Fore
